title: Economist/Principal Researcher / Économiste/Chercheur principal
description:
Position Title: Economist / Principal Researcher

Reports To: Director of Research and Stakeholder Engagement

Organization: Labour Market Information Council

Location: Anywhere in Canada (remote work)

About the Labour Market Information Council

The Labour Market Information Council (LMIC) is a not-for-profit organization established to identify and implement pan-Canadian priorities to address the need for more consistent and accessible labour market information for Canadians.

Our efforts are driven by strong collaborations with our partners in federal, provincial and territorial governments, intermediary organizations (for example, career service providers) and academic researchers.

As a dynamic, public-facing organization, LMIC offers a flexible and motivating work environment that supports excellence and rewards innovation and creative work that pushes us further.

The position

LMIC is looking for an Economist/Principal Researcher with well-honed writing, project management and critical thinking skills. The Economist/Researcher will contribute to a variety of labour market-related projects including, but not limited to, linkages between education systems and LMI, tracking green economy jobs, and identifying provincial and territorial responses to labour and skills shortages.

The ideal candidate will be one who has proven experience conducting policy-relevant qualitative research in government, academia/community partnerships, NGO, think tank or other public policy environments, as well as the ability to analyze a wide variety of data from different sources to extract salient insights for different audiences (for example, researchers, career counsellors, educators and the broader public).

The writing component of the position includes the ability to communicate complex concepts to a broad audience and to shape the content of written work to the specific targeted audience. Being able to do so in both official languages is a key asset.

The project management component of the position includes establishing project scope, setting and meeting timelines, and ongoing communication with the project team to identify changing needs and risks. In addition, many of our projects involve coordination with external partners from the government, research and non-profit sectors.

The critical thinking component of the position includes the ability to parse a variety of interrelated concepts (for example, various competing and overlapping definitions of “green jobs”) and establish clear, logical solutions for better labour market information.

Work requirements

The successful candidate will be able to:

  • Plan, co-design and carry out joint projects in a variety of areas related to a broad spectrum of labour market information distribution.
  • Generate and leverage innovative approaches for developing new and better labour market information, particularly as it relates to skills and other work requirements.
  • Manage and maintain external relationships with partners on an ongoing basis.
  • Effectively collaborate with other economists and the Communications team to ensure alignment of deliverables, including reports, data visualizations and presentations.
  • Act and react quickly to the changing organizational needs.
  • Provide recommendations for improving research methods, research tools and information products to ensure the alignment of high-quality approaches.

Qualifications and knowledge domains

  • A master’s degree in economic policy, political science, public administration, economics or other social science related field. Other combinations of education and work experience will be considered.
  • Experience conducting policy-relevant qualitative and mixed-methods research.
  • Comfortable working with statistical programming languages such as R.
  • Knowledge of labour economics and labour market policies in Canada.
  • Experience with writing for external audiences.
  • Strong English proficiency (advanced writing and verbal communication).

Assets

  • Familiarity with the labour market information system and key players.
  • Experience working with machine learning algorithms, especially natural language processing (NLP) methodologies.
  • Bilingualism in both official languages.

Location

LMIC's head office is in an accessible building in downtown Ottawa, and LMIC currently operates in a flexible hybrid work environment. As a pan-Canadian organization, we welcome applications from remote and home-based candidates anywhere in Canada.

Inclusion

At LMIC we are committed to workplace inclusion. Candidates of all backgrounds, including but not limited to individuals with international experience, newcomers to Canada, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and persons of various gender identities and sexual orientations are encouraged to apply. We welcome the opportunity to discuss accommodations at any point of the application process.

Compensation and benefits

The positions provide a competitive total rewards package that aligns with the skills and competencies of the individual and includes, extended health coverage, flexible work/life policies, vacation, sick and personal leave and RRSP benefits. The position entails a full-time employment opportunity with a one-year renewable contract and an anticipated two-year minimum employment term.

The salary range for this position is $67,000-$77,000, commensurate with candidate experience and qualifications.

How to apply

Apply through Indeed no later than May 15, 2022.

Contact Information

If you require accommodations, alternative job posting formats, alternative application methods, or any other support with your application please contact us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Titre du poste : Économiste/Chercheur principal

Relève du : Directeur de la recherche et des relations avec les parties prenantes

Organisation : Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail (CIMT)

Lieu : N’importe où au Canada (télétravail)

À propos du Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail

Le Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail (CIMT) est un organisme sans but lucratif créé pour définir et mettre en œuvre des priorités pancanadiennes afin de répondre au besoin d’une information plus uniforme et accessible sur le marché du travail pour les Canadiens et les Canadiennes.

Nos efforts sont motivés par de solides collaborations avec nos partenaires au sein des gouvernements fédéral, provinciaux et territoriaux, des organisations intermédiaires (par exemple, les fournisseurs de services de carrière) et des chercheurs universitaires.

En tant qu’organisme dynamique et public, le CIMT offre un environnement de travail flexible et motivant qui soutient l’excellence et récompense l’innovation et le travail créatif qui nous pousse à aller plus loin.

Le poste

Le CIMT est à la recherche d'économiste/chercheur principal possédant des compétences en rédaction, en gestion de projet et en pensée critique. L'économiste/chercheur principal contribuera à une variété de projets liés au marché du travail, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, les liens entre les systèmes d'éducation et l'IMT, le suivi des emplois de l'économie verte, et l'identification des réponses provinciales et territoriales aux pénuries de main-d'œuvre et de compétences.

La personne retenue sera celle qui possède une expérience avérée dans la conduite de recherches qualitatives pertinentes pour les politiques publiques au sein de gouvernements, de partenariats universitaires/communautaires, d'ONG, de groupes de réflexion ou d'autres environnements de politique publique, ainsi que la capacité d’analyser une grande variété de données provenant de différentes sources afin d’en tirer des renseignements pertinents pour différents publics (par exemple, chercheurs/chercheures, conseillers/conseillères en orientation professionnelle, éducateurs/éducatrices et le grand public).

Le volet rédaction du poste comprend la capacité de communiquer des concepts complexes à un large public et de façonner le contenu des travaux écrits pour le public cible. La capacité à le faire dans les deux langues officielles est un atout majeur.

Le volet gestion de projet du poste comprend l'établissement de la portée du projet, la planification et le respect des échéanciers, ainsi que la communication continue avec l'équipe de projet afin d'identifier les besoins changeants et les risques. En outre, plusieurs de nos projets impliquent une coordination avec des partenaires externes du gouvernement, du secteur de la recherche et/ou du secteur sans but lucratif.

Le volet pensée critique du poste comprend la capacité d’analyser divers concepts interdépendants (par exemple, diverses compétences concurrentes et des définitions qui se superposent pour les "emplois verts".) et d’établir des solutions claires et logiques pour améliorer l’information sur le marché du travail.

Exigences professionnelles

La personne retenue doit être en mesure :

  • De planifier, de concevoir et de réaliser des projets conjoints dans divers domaines liés à un large éventail de diffusion de l’information sur le marché du travail.
  • D’élaborer et exploiter des approches novatrices pour développer de l’information nouvelle et meilleure sur le marché du travail, particulièrement en ce qui concerne les compétences et les autres exigences de travail.
  • De gérer et d’entretenir en permanence les relations externes avec les partenaires.
  • De collaborer efficacement avec d’autres économistes et l’équipe des communications pour assurer l’harmonisation des produits livrables, y compris les rapports, les visualisations de données et les présentations.
  • D’agir et de réagir rapidement à l’évolution des besoins organisationnels.
  • De formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les méthodes de recherche, les outils de recherche et les produits d’information afin d’assurer l’harmonisation des approches de haute qualité.

Qualifications et domaines de connaissances

  • Maîtrise en politique économique, science politique, administration publique, économie ou dans d’autres domaines liés aux sciences sociales. D’autres combinaisons d’études et d’expérience de travail seront prises en compte.
  • Expérience mener des recherches qualitatives et mixtes pertinentes pour l'élaboration des politiques.
  • Capacité à travailler avec des langages de programmation statistique tels que R.
  • Connaissance de l'économie du travail et des politiques du marché du travail au Canada.
  • Expérience de la rédaction pour des publics externes.
  • Connaissance avancée de l’anglais (compréhension, expression écrite et orale).

Atouts

  • Connaissance du système d’information sur le marché du travail et des acteurs clés.
  • Connaissance d'un ou plusieurs outils de collaboration sur le Web, tels que Slack, Miro ou Jamboard.
  • Bilinguisme dans les deux langues officielles.

Lieu

Le siège social du CIMT est situé dans un immeuble accessible au centre-ville d’Ottawa, et le CIMT fonctionne actuellement dans un environnement de travail hybride souple. En tant qu’organisme pancanadien, nous accueillons les candidatures de personnes travaillant à distance ou à domicile partout au Canada.

Inclusion

Au CIMT, nous nous engageons à favoriser l’inclusion en milieu de travail. Nous encourageons les candidatures de tous les horizons, y compris, mais sans s’y limiter, les personnes ayant de l’expérience à l’étranger, les nouveaux arrivants au Canada, les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les membres des minorités visibles, et les personnes de diverses identités de genre et orientations sexuelles. Nous serons heureux de discuter des mesures d’adaptation à tout moment du processus de candidature.

Rémunération et avantages sociaux

Le poste offre un ensemble de mesures concurrentielles qui reflète les aptitudes et les compétences de la personne, et comprend une assurance-maladie complémentaire, des politiques souples de travail et de vie privée, des vacances, des congés de maladie et des congés personnels, ainsi que des prestations de REER. Il s’agit d’un emploi à temps plein dans le cadre d’un contrat de 18 mois avec possibilité de renouvellement.

L’échelle salariale de départ pour ce poste est de 55 000 $ à 65 000 $, en fonction de l’expérience et des qualifications de la personne retenue.

Comment poser votre candidature

Poser votre candidature par l’intermédiaire de Indeed au plus tard le 15 mai 2022.

Coordonnées

Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, d’autres formats d’affichage d’emploi, d’autres méthodes de candidature ou de tout autre soutien pour votre candidature, veuillez communiquer avec nous et nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 18 months

Salary: $55,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-15

title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Analyste en informatique décisionnelle
description:
Position Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Reports To: Data Lead

Organization: Labour Market Information Council

Location: Anywhere in Canada (remote work)

About the Labour Market Information Council

The Labour Market Information Council (LMIC) is a not-for-profit organization established to identify and implement pan-Canadian priorities to address the need for more consistent and accessible labour market information for Canadians.

Our efforts are driven by strong collaborations with our partners in federal, provincial and territorial governments, intermediary organizations (for example, career service providers) and academic researchers.

As a dynamic, public-facing organization, LMIC offers a flexible and motivating work environment that supports excellence and rewards innovation and creative work that pushes us further.

The position

LMIC is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the development and maintenance of a cloud-based data warehouse built in a leading-edge infrastructure.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will help improve business processes that optimize the gathering, storing and processing of disparate datasets and spreadsheets. They will contribute to defining the business rules to calculate and distribute labour market information as source-agnostic indicators. They will also support the team’s projects as they relate to data sourcing, cleaning and ensuring data use is auditable.

Work requirements

The successful candidate will be able to:

· Develop solutions that improve business performance through streamlined processes for handling data gathering, cleaning and labelling.

· Apply problem-solving, critical thinking, creativity, organizational, design and interpersonal skills in the context of a multifaceted and fast-moving project.

· Work independently and establish priorities that meet organizational deadlines.

· Effectively collaborate with other economists to ensure alignment of deliverables, including reports, data visualizations and presentations.

· Act and react quickly to changing organizational needs.

· Provide recommendations for improving research methods, research tools and information products to ensure the alignment of high-quality approaches.

Qualifications and knowledge domains

· A master’s degree in economics, business, public policy or related fields. Other combinations of education and work experience will be considered.

· Expertise in optimizing business processes, particularly as it relates to data/file management.

· Excellent customer experience intuition; demonstrated success in inventing innovative and user-friendly products.

· Ability to drive transformation through the automation of existing processes, and testing and optimizing business processes.

Assets

· Bilingualism in both official languages (French and English).

· Knowledge of labour economics and labour market policies in Canada.

· Superior written and verbal communication skills.

· Knowledge of programming languages to analyze and transform data, such as Python and SQL.

· Familiarity with statistical programming languages (R preferred).

Location

LMIC's head office is in an accessible building in downtown Ottawa, and LMIC currently operates in a flexible hybrid work environment. As a pan-Canadian organization, we welcome applications from remote and home-based candidates anywhere in Canada.

Inclusion

At LMIC we are committed to workplace inclusion. Candidates of all backgrounds including but not limited to individuals with international experience, newcomers to Canada, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and persons of various gender identities and sexual orientations are encouraged to apply. We welcome the opportunity to discuss accommodations at any point of the application process.

Compensation and benefits

The position provides a competitive package that aligns with the skills and competencies of the individual, and includes extended health coverage, flexible work/life policies, vacation, sick and personal leave, and RRSP benefits. The position entails a full-time employment opportunity under an 18-month contract with the possibility of renewal.

The starting salary range for this position is $67,000 - $77,000, commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications.

How to apply

Apply through Indeed no later than May 11, 2022.

Contact Information

If you require accommodations, alternative job posting formats, alternative application methods, or any other support with your application please contact us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Titre du poste : Analyste en informatique décisionnelle

Supérieur hiérarchique : Chef des données

Organisme : Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail

Lieu : N’importe où au Canada (télétravail)

À propos du Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail

Le Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail (CIMT) est un organisme indépendant sans but lucratif qui a été créé pour permettre aux Canadiens et aux Canadiennes de prendre des décisions éclairées en leur donnant accès à des données et à des renseignements de qualité, pertinents et complets dans l’ensemble de l’écosystème pancanadien de l’IMT.

Nos efforts sont motivés par de solides collaborations avec nos partenaires au sein des gouvernements fédéral, provinciaux et territoriaux, des organisations intermédiaires (par exemple, les fournisseurs de services de carrière) et des chercheurs universitaires.

En tant qu’organisme dynamique et public, le CIMT offre la possibilité de travailler sur des données de pointe et des analyses conceptuelles au cœur des défis et des politiques du marché du travail d’aujourd’hui. Nous offrons un environnement de travail flexible et motivant qui soutient l’excellence et récompense l’innovation et le travail créatif qui nous pousse à aller plus loin.

Le poste

Le CIMT est à la recherche d’une personne qui occupera le poste d’analyste en informatique décisionnelle pour soutenir le développement et la maintenance d’un entrepôt de données infonuagique construit dans une infrastructure de pointe.

L’analyste en informatique décisionnelle aidera à améliorer les processus opérationnels qui optimisent la collecte, le stockage et le traitement d’ensembles de données et de feuilles de calcul disparates. La personne retenue contribuera à définir des règles opérationnelles pour calculer et diffuser les informations sur le marché du travail en tant qu’indicateurs indépendants de la source. Elle soutiendra également les projets de l’équipe en ce qui a trait à l’approvisionnement en données, au nettoyage et à la vérification de l’utilisation des données.

Exigences de travail

La personne retenue sera en mesure :

· D’élaborer des solutions qui améliorent le rendement opérationnel grâce à des processus simplifiés pour la collecte, le nettoyage et l’étiquetage des données.

· D’appliquer ses compétences en résolution de problèmes, en pensée critique, en créativité, en organisation, en conception et en relations interpersonnelles dans le contexte d’un projet à multiples facettes qui évolue rapidement.

· De travailler de façon autonome et d’établir des priorités qui respectent les délais de l’organisme.

· De collaborer efficacement avec d’autres économistes pour assurer l’harmonisation des produits livrables, y compris les rapports, les visualisations de données et les présentations.

· D’agir et de réagir rapidement aux besoins changeants de l’organisme.

· De formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les techniques de recherche, les outils de recherche et les produits d’information afin d’assurer l’harmonisation des approches de haute qualité.

Qualifications et domaines de connaissances

· Une maîtrise en économie, en affaires, en politique publique ou dans des domaines connexes. D’autres combinaisons d’études et d’expérience professionnelle seront prises en compte.

· Expertise dans l’optimisation des processus opérationnels, en particulier en ce qui concerne la gestion des données et des fichiers.

· Excellent sens de l’expérience client; capacité avérée à inventer des produits innovants et conviviaux.

· Capacité à promouvoir la transformation par l’automatisation des processus existants, ainsi que par la mise à l’essai et l’optimisation des processus opérationnels.

Atouts

· Bilinguisme dans les deux langues officielles (français et anglais).

· Connaissance de l’économie du travail et des politiques du marché du travail au Canada.

· Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale.

· Connaissance des langages de programmation pour analyser et transformer les données, comme Python et SQL.

· Connaissance des langages de programmation statistique (R de préférence).

Lieu

Le siège social du CIMT est situé dans un immeuble accessible au centre-ville d’Ottawa, et le CIMT fonctionne actuellement dans un environnement de travail hybride souple. En tant qu’organisme pancanadien, nous accueillons les candidatures de personnes travaillant à distance ou à domicile au Canada.

Inclusion

Au CIMT, nous nous engageons à favoriser l’inclusion en milieu de travail. Nous encourageons les candidatures de tous les horizons, y compris, mais sans s’y limiter, les personnes ayant de l’expérience à l’étranger, les nouveaux arrivants au Canada, les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les membres des minorités visibles, et les personnes de diverses identités de genre et orientations sexuelles. Nous serons heureux de discuter des mesures d’adaptation à tout moment du processus de candidature.

Rémunération et avantages sociaux

Le poste offre un ensemble de mesures concurrentielles qui reflète les aptitudes et les compétences de la personne, et comprend une assurance-maladie complémentaire, des politiques souples de travail et de vie privée, des vacances, des congés de maladie et des congés personnels, ainsi que des prestations de REER. Il s’agit d’un emploi à temps plein dans le cadre d’un contrat de 18 mois avec possibilité de renouvellement.

L’échelle salariale de départ pour ce poste est de 67 000 $ à 77 000 $, en fonction de l’expérience et des qualifications de la personne retenue.

Comment poser votre candidature

Poser votre candidature par l’intermédiaire de Indeed au plus tard le 11 mai 2022.

Coordonnées

Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, d’autres formats d’affichage d’emploi, d’autres méthodes de candidature ou de tout autre soutien pour votre candidature, veuillez communiquer avec nous et nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 18 months

Salary: $67,000.00-$77,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-11

Show more

title: Senior Decarbonization Advisor
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

GTA

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.


The Opportunity:


WSP Canada has an immediate opening for a Senior Decarbonization Advisor to join our national Climate Change, Resilience and Sustainability team as part of our growing Climate Advisory practice. This role is primarily focused on leading and delivering strategic net zero advisory services to key Canadian and international businesses and investors, from establishing GHG baselines and setting Net Zero and Science-based Targets, to GHG reduction pathways including developing and implementing action plans . As a Senior Advisor, you will play a leading role in our climate advisory practice to support the strategic direction of the business, and with the other seniors in our practice to deliver key projects and grow the business.

You will be part of one of Canada’s largest climate change consulting teams, which includes of climate change engineers, scientists, economists, and policy professionals who support our clients to build a low-carbon and resilient Canada.

This role can be based in any major city centre in Canada, with opportunities to relocate within Canada as your career develops here at WSP.


Our Climate Advisory team is growing quickly. Our clients include TSX-60 companies, Fortune 50 companies, large investors, private companies, and private equity funds. Within the Climate Change, Resilience and Sustainability team, our Climate Advisory practice focuses on the climate change aspects of the ‘E’, although not to the exclusion of other aspects of E, S, or G.

We are distinct in the market owing to:

  • Our technical depth and expertise, in addition to the strategic advisory services we provide.
  • The scale of our team – we are the largest pure climate change consulting team in Canada, working with some of the largest investors and companies in the country and the Federal government.
  • Our broad client base across IT, finance, real estate, mining, natural resources, infrastructure, public sector, communities, forestry, CPG, and international organizations such as the UN and the Principles for Responsible Investing.
  • Our own corporate climate commitments and achievements which include:
    • WSP’s Verified Science-Based Targets
    • Our leadership in the Business Ambition for 1.5 degrees
    • Achieving A– the second-best score, on our CDP submissions in 2019 and 2020
    • Being named the “Most Sustainable Company in the Engineering Sector” globally in 2020

Within the Earth & Environment Business Line, our team regularly collaborates with other teams and our colleagues from Buildings, Transportation, Infrastructure, Energy, and Industry. You will be part of the global WSP network which means regular collaboration with our Resilience and Sustainability colleagues globally.

We’re growing our team with individuals from diverse backgrounds because we believe in the benefits of diversity of thought, creativity, innovation, new perspectives and ideas – and we want to offer the same to our clients.

We’re a collaborative team with a flexible approach and we offer a wide variety of projects and cross-functional opportunities to work together.

Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Spearheading or supporting the delivery of projects for clients;
  • Leading the delivery of projects for clients with a focus on advising corporates across all sectors on assessing their GHG emissions (Scope 1, 2 & 3), setting net zero and science-based targets, GHG reduction pathways and scenarios, developing and implementing implementation plans.
  • Focusing on business development, including enhancing the relationships we foster with our current clients and expanding to new clients.
  • Taking charge of the development and improvement of services and collaborating within WSP’s Business Lines while providing climate change advisory services to other teams or on projects outside of the Climate Change, Resilience and Sustainability team.
  • Acting as a senior advisor in climate and ESG across WSP – generally remaining active in the relevant academic, scientific, and professional community through presentations and participation in seminars, conferences and symposiums and other activities.
  • You’ll be managing multiple projects as an independent contributor and adhering to appropriate deadlines while also provide technical mentorship and support to junior team members.

What you'll bring to WSP ...

  • Direct experience in climate change and decarbonization strategy development, specifically direct experience with GHG accounting standards (such as the GHG Protocol, ISO 14064) and experience conducting GHG inventories, setting targets, and and developing decarbonization pathways
  • Advanced degrees in engineering or science, or studies in a relevant field
  • Intermediate to senior level experience (6+ years) industry experience in providing technical support on a variety of climate change mandates

Ideally you will have expertise in one or more of the following areas:

  • Energy efficiency / GHG management; including a deep technical understanding of decarbonization mechanisms and technologies
  • Experience with lifecycle assessment LCA databases (such as GaBi and EcoInvent) considered an asset;
  • Experience conducting Scope 3 value chain GHG assessments and knowledge of Scope 3 techniques and methods;
  • Familiarity with the PCAF standard and experience quantifying financed emissions considered an asset;
  • Knowledge of target setting approaches including science-based targets;
  • Familiarity with the TCFD, CDP, GRI, SASB and other sustainability reporting frameworks ;
  • An understanding of low carbon technologies, renewable energy, and new emerging technologies such as CCS, hydrogen, etc.;
  • Experience working on GHG emission reduction initiatives, delivering decarbonization strategies and associated cost/benefit analysis;
  • Relevant knowledge of carbon offset markets and programs;
  • Ability to navigate large and complex data sets and extract insightful observations;
  • Research and analytical skills - you’re able to identify, review and synthesize key findings in scientific and engineering literature, reports, other relevant publications to client audiences and project teams;
  • Ability to navigate large and complex data sets and extract insightful observations;
  • Ability to write concise, clear and effective narratives in reporting, in presentations, and contributions to proposals;
  • Ability to collaborate remotely across geographies and sectors; and,
  • Additional language skills (French or Spanish) would be a bonus

#LI-Hybrid


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Toronto, ON

Show more

title: Assistant Professor
description:
Please refer to the
How to Apply for a Job (for External Candidates)
job aid for instructions on how to apply.
If you are an active McGill employee (ie: currently in an active contract or position at McGill University), do not apply through this Career Site. Login to your McGill Workday account and apply to this posting using the Find Jobs report (type Find Jobs in the search bar).
Position Description, duties, and qualifications and requirements: The School of Information Studies (SIS), an academic unit in the Faculty of Arts at McGill University, invites applications for a tenure-stream appointment at the Assistant Professor rank. The anticipated start date is January 1, 2023. Qualified candidates should have a doctoral degree in information studies or equivalent. In addition, the ideal candidate will have a record of research publications in high quality, peer-reviewed journals, evidence of effective teaching, and clear promise of pursuing an interesting and innovative research agenda. While all teaching is in English, knowledge of French or a willingness to learn French is highly desirable. Research expertise is sought in the general area of Human Information Interaction (HII) and more specifically in the core areas of data science and cybersecurity. Ideally, the candidate should also have research expertise in cyber threat intelligence, cyber-physical systems security, digital forensics, cybersecurity incident response and management. Proficient knowledge in AI for cybersecurity will be an asset. The successful candidate will be expected to conduct research, teach courses at the graduate level and participate in university and professional community service activities. In addition, candidates are expected to advise and supervise Master’s and Doctoral students in the School.
McGill University
Founded in 1821, McGill University is a world-renowned institution located in the heart of the cosmopolitan Montreal and is consistently ranked among the world’s top universities. As one of McGill’s oldest faculties, the Faculty of Arts is home to more than 7000 undergraduates and 1200 graduate students, comprising the largest and most diverse faculty in the University. The School of Information Studies has an enrolment of approximately 200 graduate students (included over 30 doctoral students) with a Master’s program that has been continuously accredited by the ALA since 1927. McGill is located in Montreal, a North American city with a European “flavor.” It is a vibrant, bilingual city that offers an impressive range of cultural activities. Montreal offers accessible housing costs, health care, day care and bilingual (French and/or English) schooling. It was deemed the safest and one of the best cities in North America by The Economist and also ranks very high in terms of equal opportunities for people of different origins.

Faculty/Department/Unit:
School of Information Studies, Faculty of Arts

Job Type:
Academic Tenure Stream

Rank:
Assistant Professor

Salary:
Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Posting Period:
Please submit your application within 30 days of the publication of this advertisement.

Required Documents:
Your application should include:
  • cover letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • brief research statement
  • brief statement of teaching philosophy plus documentation of teaching effectiveness (if available),
  • names and addresses (contact information ) of three referees
  • copies of representative research article(s)
  • These documents are to be uploaded in the 'CV/Resumé’ section of your application

Use a personal email address when creating an account in Workday to submit your application. Do not use @mail.mcgill.ca or @mcgill.ca email accounts to apply.

Please follow the Workday job application instructions for external users:
https://www.mcgill.ca/hr/files/hr/apply_at_mcgill_university_-_guide_for_external_candidates_en_4.pdf
McGill University is committed to equity and diversity within its community and values academic rigour and excellence. We welcome and encourage applications from racialized persons/visible minorities, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, and persons of minority sexual orientations and gender identities, as well as from all qualified candidates with the skills and knowledge to engage productively with diverse communities.
At McGill, research that reflects diverse intellectual traditions, methodologies, and modes of dissemination and translation is valued and encouraged. Candidates are invited to demonstrate their research impact both within and across academic disciplines and in other sectors, such as government, communities, or industry.
McGill further recognizes and fairly considers the impact of leaves (e.g., family care or health-related) that may contribute to career interruptions or slowdowns. Candidates are encouraged to signal any leave that affected productivity, or that may have had an effect on their career path. This information will be considered to ensure the equitable assessment of the candidate’s record.
McGill implements an employment equity program and encourages members of designated equity groups to self-identify. It further seeks to ensure the equitable treatment and full inclusion of persons with disabilities by striving for the implementation of universal design principles transversally, across all facets of the University community, and through
accommodation policies and procedures
. Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence,
accessibilityrequest.hr@mcgill.ca
.
All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.
Show more

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
We're the technology leader building the modern home management platform. Today, millions of people use Thumbtack to effortlessly manage their homes. We help them confidently know what to do, when to do it and who to hire.

Our goal is simple: to be the only platform homeowners need to fix, maintain and improve their homes. As a long-term partner for homeowners, our promise is to turn what was once confusing and intimidating into something straightforward — and a lot less stressful.

At Thumbtack, we're not just creating a new era of homeownership. We're supporting local economies and building stronger communities. Each day, we connect local professionals across America with busy homeowners so they can grow their businesses.

Thumbtack is for everyone. Our customers and pros come from all walks of life and every county in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply.

Our North Star is bright and our ambitions are big. We've been at this for over a decade, but the way we see it: we're just getting started.

Thumbtack by the Numbers

  • Available in all 3,143 U.S. counties.
  • Nearly 4.5 million customers in the last 12 months
  • Hundreds of thousands of local professionals on our platform
  • 65 million projects started on Thumbtack
  • Over 7.5 million 5-star reviews left for stellar pros

About the Data Science Team

We're looking for data scientists with deep expertise in machine learning, optimization, building data products, and/or statistics. As part of a small product team you will have full ownership over your domain, so you should be a person who dreams big, then executes well

At Thumbtack, the Data Science team is responsible for a wide variety of problems spanning machine learning, statistics, and computer science:

  • Characterize marketplace dynamics. Thumbtack's marketplaces are comprised of thousands of active markets across our service categories and U.S. cities. Via exploratory data analysis and experimental design, our team works to understand trends and behaviors within these markets.
  • Improve customer and service provider matching. Matching and optimization algorithms are fundamental to Thumbtack's product: we now service millions of matches per week. Identifying better matches between customers and service providers has an incredible impact on the experience of customers and professionals transacting on our platform.
  • Model complex relationships in the presence of many confounding factors. Predictive modeling problems are everywhere across our product. Our team works to scope, design and implement machine learning models to support Thumbtack's product.

Responsibilities

  • Design and execute experiments, collect and analyze data to characterize our product
  • Architect and deploy machine learning systems to production
  • Design and implement metrics that align with company goals
  • Analyze a wide variety of data: structured and unstructured, observational and experimental
  • Collaborate with engineering, marketing, and economists to use sound statistical practices.

Must-Have Qualifications

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

  • M.S. or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Math, Statistics, or other relevant technical field
  • Expert knowledge of machine learning techniques: regression and classification, clustering, neural networks, boosted decision trees, etc.
  • Ability to effectively read, write, and debug code in programming languages such as Python
  • Good knowledge of probability and statistics, including experimental design, optimization, and causal inference
  • Excellent written and verbal technical communication skills

Nice-to-Have Qualifications

    • Ph.D. in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Math, or Statistics
    • Expert knowledge of probability and statistics, including experimental design, predictive modeling, optimization, and causal inference
    • Experience with large-scale distributed systems

More About Us

Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Ontario or the Philippines. When it is safe to gather, we will begin to host in-person events on a regular basis. Remote employees will be expected to travel occasionally for these events to a Thumbtack library or offsite team-building location. In cities with 5+ employees, we are establishing local communities, where employees can gather for local events. Additionally, employees in the San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto and Manila areas will have opt-in access to communal workspace at one of our Thumbtack libraries. We always prioritize the health and safety of our employees. Currently, participation in these events and Thumbtack library use are optional. Both require employees to be fully vaccinated.

#LI-Remote


More About Us

Thumbtack is a technology leader building the modern home management platform. Through the Thumbtack app, homeowners can effortlessly manage their homes — confidently knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. Bringing the $500 billion home services industry online, Thumbtack empowers millions of homeowners to fix, maintain, and improve their most valuable asset.

Founded in 2008, Thumbtack is backed by over $500 million in funding from folks that include Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners, Baillie Gifford.

  • See what it's like to work here
  • Meet the pros who inspire us
  • Follow us on LinkedIn
  • Discover our virtual first plan

Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtack's Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/.

  • Currently, Thumbtackers can live anywhere in Ontario, Canada or the Philippines or in any of the following US states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, HI, IL, IN, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI. Our long term vision is to hire across all of the United States and Canada, but this expansion will take a few years.
Show more

title: Senior Game Economy Designer
description:
THE JOB:

As a senior game economy designer at Amber, you'll make a significant impact on many games in our portfolio spanning different genres, platforms and hit franchises. If you're passionate about crafting deep economies that challenge and engage players, while mentoring the next generation of talented game economists, we want to meet you!

YOUR MISSION:

  • Play a senior economy design role on several world-class game projects
  • Design meta-game systems, monetization mechanics, content balancing, and more
  • Leverage modelling, testing, and metrics to refine your work
  • Work closely with game designers, artists, and programmers to turn your ideas into reality
  • Champion the discipline of economy design by mentoring and giving feedback
  • Use knowledge of game economy to pitch creative ideas for new features and projects

YOUR SKILLS:

  • 7+ years of experience as a game economy designer, or equivalent background
  • Expert knowledge of free-to-play economy and monetization fundamentals
  • Advanced understanding of game metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Proven experience mentoring junior team members
  • Proficient English with outstanding verbal, written, and visual communication skills
  • Extensive experience using common economy design tools, like Excel
  • Collaborative spirit and love of teamwork

OUR OFFER:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Chance to advance your career at a fast growing company
  • Extensive support for your continued learning and development
  • Community-oriented culture that supports giving back to make a difference

OUR WORK ENVIRONMENT:

During the COVID-19 pandemic, you'll onboard and work 100% remotely. At Amber, our teams excel at working together across borders and time zones. Once its safe to reopen our physical offices, we'll encourage a hybrid culture that balances office collaboration with work from home. But we're open to permanent remote work arrangements for the right candidate.

title: Policy analysts and economists - Inventory - Indigenous Recruitment
company: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
description:
Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
Ottawa (Ontario), Gatineau (Québec)
EC-02
  • LOCATION: Due to Covid-19, our teams work virtually from home using the latest technologies to stay connected.
$62,168 to $71,275

For further information on the organization, please visit Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada

Closing date: 30 August 2022 - 23:59, Pacific Time

Who can apply: You must meet both of the following criteria :

Members of the following Employment Equity group: Indigenous persons* (First Nations, Métis, and/or Inuit)
AND
Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad

  • This inventory is targeted to Indigenous persons who will self-declare as an Indigenous person. An Indigenous person is a North American Indian or a member of a First Nation, Métis or Inuit. North American Indians or members of a First Nation include treaty, status or registered Indians, as well as on-status and non-registered Indians.
The Indigenous affiliation will be verified at the time of the appointment.*

Apply online

Important messages

Step 1: Send us your interest!
  • Apply now via this poster by clicking on 'apply online' at the bottom of the page.

Step 2: Let's learn more about you!
  • After we receive your application, a questionnaire will be sent to you by email by the end of summer. The questionnaire will assess the education and experiences required and ask you about your interest, strengths, areas of development and career goals. An email containing a link to the questionnaire will be sent to the email address you provided in your application. It will therefore be your responsibility to ensure that the e-mail address you provided is valid and contains no errors. We invite you to verify your spam e-mails regularly.

Step 3: Assessment & Matching!
  • Your application will be carefully considered. If your education and experiences match a position, you might be contacted for the next assessment phase. Please note that this phase will take place in the fall.

If you have any questions or need accommodation, please feel free to contact us!

Not sure how to apply? Send us a question and we will be glad to help! If you are not able to apply online, please contact the team below for assistance.

Thank you / Merci / Wela'lin / Ekosani / Miigwech / Meegwetch / Mahseecho / Mutna / Wopida / Hei Hei / Marci Cho / ᖁᐊᓇᖅᑯᑎᑦ / Quanaqqutit / Nakurmik / Kukwstsétsemc / Woliwun / Nià:wen

Duties

The government tabled Budget 2021, which focuses on key themes to help support Canadians in the years ahead, including finishing the fight against COVID-19, creating jobs and growth, and ensuring a resilient and inclusive recovery. Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada's (ISED) will continue to play an important role in advancing initiatives in each of the budgetary themes. Our work is diversified and touches on various topics, such as innovation, science, industry, tourism and small business. You’ll get to work on a wide variety of initiatives that directly impact the Canadian economy as well as our daily lives as Canadians and as ISED employees.

You could be working on:
  • Developing policies on guiding government investment programs and economic development activities;
  • Participating in consultations and exploring various models to support government priorities;
  • Developing strategic advice with regard to federal efforts.

The area you could be interested in:
Copyright, international relations or trade negotiations, domestic trade, Canada’s bankruptcy and insolvency system, business finance, foreign investment, competition policy, science policy, innovation and technology-related policy, telecommunications policy, small business policy, tourism policy, micro-economic or industrial policy, spectrum, digital and ICT policies and many more.

What about your career?
ISED also has developmental program which progresses initially from EC-02 to EC-04 and completes at the EC-05.

Work environment

Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED) is proud to be named one of Canada's Top 100 Employers 2022, National Capital Region’s Top Employer 2022, and Canada’s Best Diversity Employers 2022. These awards recognize Canadian employers with exceptional human resources programs, forward-thinking workplace policies, and exceptional workplace diversity and inclusiveness programs.

ISED’s goal is to transition to a hybrid work environment where we can enjoy flexibility, bring people together to create a healthy and inclusive workplace, and fulfill our operational requirements.

Intent of the process

This process aims to create and maintain an inventory of Indigenous persons (First Nations, Métis, and/or Inuit) for casual, indeterminate or term appointments within Innovation Science and Economic Developpment. A pool of qualified candidates may be established and may be used to fill similar positions with various locations and tenures.

When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment. Based on the hiring needs, additional essential qualifications, asset qualifications, organizational needs, operational requirements and/or conditions of employment may be identified and applied during the assessment and/or selection of candidates.

Positions to be filled: Number to be determined

Information you must provide

Your résumé.

In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)

EDUCATION
  • Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in Economics, Sociology or Statistics (acceptable specialization is at least one full year course or two half-year courses in Economics, Sociology or Statistics).

Part A
Notes: Candidates must always have a degree. The courses for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. The specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.

Degree equivalency

EXPERIENCE where you:
  • Conducted research and analysis;
  • Performed in a team environment.
COMPETENCIES
  • Achieving Results
  • Adaptability
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Initiative
  • Relationship Management and Collaboration
  • Effective Interactive Communication
  • Written Communication
  • Research

KNOWLEDGE
  • Knowledge of subject matter such as legislation, policies and/or practices relevant to the position being staffed.

The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)

Various language requirements
  • Bilingual Imperative - BBB/BBB, CBC/CBC, English essential or French essential

Information on language requirements

The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)

THE ASSET EDUCATION
  • Graduation with a Master’s degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, sociology, statistics, business/commerce, political science, public policy, mathematics or a related field.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Depending on the position to staff, the following operational requirements could be applicable: Willingness and ability to work overtime or/and Willingness and ability to travel.

Conditions of employment

Depending on the position to staff, conditiions of employment can vary between : Reliability Security Clearance or Secret Security Clearance.

All employees of the core public administration are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and attest to their vaccination status unless accommodated based on a medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act.

Other information

The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.

Information on employment equity

Preference

Preference will be given to veterans first and then to Canadian citizens and permanent residents, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.

Information on the preference to veterans

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Sr Analyst/Consultant, Real World Data Solutions
description:
At Certara, we accelerate medicines to patients by partnering with life science innovators.

In the past 6 years, over 90% of companies that received new drug approvals by the FDA used our software or services. Our integrated and proprietary end-to-end platform with biosimulation, regulatory science, and market access solutions combined with our strong team of scientists and subject matter experts enable our clients to have:

  • informed decision-making & reduced clinical trial burden
  • higher R&D productivity
  • improved patient outcomes & increased patient access to medicines
  • accelerated regulatory approval

Certara is a global team that fosters and nurtures a diverse and inclusive culture. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, and unique capabilities and talent represents a significant part of our culture, our reputation and our achievement.

Together with our partners, we use biosimulation and technology-enabled services to transform drug discovery and development across all therapeutic areas and innovative therapies.


Job Overview:

This is a great opportunity for an early career Epidemiologist/Pharmaco-Epidemiologist/Public Health professional to join a team of highly skilled epidemiologists, statisticians, health economists and consultants. The successful candidate will work closely with other senior scientific staff within the company. This position will allow the Senior Analyst/ Epidemiologist to deepen his/her skills by writing protocols for observational studies using a variety of healthcare databases, primary and secondary data collection, as well as providing scientific and other technical input during conception, conduct and delivery of various research projects.


Main tasks & responsibilities

  • Support RWDS project teams and be accountable to the project manager/director for those projects
  • Summarize and synthesize a wide range of medical and statistical information, including disease specific and pharmaceutical product research
  • Develop an understanding of Regulatory/HTA requirements for RWE, at least in the European and/or North American context
  • Support development of study documents (eg. protocols, analysis plans, reports, posters, manuscripts) under guidance from scientific team members and project manager/s
  • Liaise and manage processes with ethics committees, application committees and other relevant stakeholders to support acquisition of data for studies
  • Interpret and communicate the results of clinical/observational studies, health economic models (cost-effectiveness and budget impact) and statistical analyses
  • Undertake primary and secondary research initiatives including the retrieval and analysis of data, competitive product pipeline information, epidemiology trends, etc. according to needs of the project
  • Participates in production of reports, presentations and publications.
  • Critically analyzes data (presents results and provides internal data analysis, both qualitative and quantitative) and provides strategic thinking with respect to interpretation of results
  • Interact with and foster relationships with existing network of scientific/clinical/payer experts and data providers
  • Liaise with other consultants assigned to the project to ensure quality delivery of the project
  • Support senior personnel with activities required for business development from time to time
  • Align with and work within the framework of SOPs for data governance with respect to projects led


Required Qualifications / Experience

  • Minimum of Master’s Degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Medicine or other related field
  • At least 2 years relevant post-graduate work experience preferred


Required Skills

  • Professional proficiency in English, written and spoken
  • Experience designing/writing protocol for database or other observational studies
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of the team
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects


OTHER INFORMATION:

This position can be office based or work-from-home in the UK, EU, Canada or USA.

Number of Employees Supervised: None

Percentage of Travel Required: 0-10% travel


Certara bases all employment-related decision on merit, taking into consideration qualifications, skills, achievement, and performance. We treat all applicants and employees without regard to personal characteristics such as race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental condition, genetic information, military service, or other characteristic protected by law.


#LI-HM

2198

title: Junior Data Engineer / Ingénieur/ingénieure de données subalterne
description:
Position Title: Junior Data Engineer

Reports To: Data Lead

Organization: Labour Market Information Council

Location: Anywhere in Canada (remote work)

About the Labour Market Information Council

The Labour Market Information Council (LMIC) is a not-for-profit organization established to identify and implement pan-Canadian priorities to address the need for more consistent and accessible labour market information for Canadians.

Our efforts are driven by strong collaborations with our partners in federal, provincial and territorial governments, intermediary organizations (for example, career service providers) and academic researchers.

As a dynamic, public-facing organization, LMIC offers a flexible and motivating work environment that supports excellence and rewards innovation and creative work that pushes us further.

The position
LMIC is looking for a Junior Data Engineer to support the end-to-end development and maintenance of a cloud-based data warehouse built in a leading-edge infrastructure.

The Junior Data Engineer will also help create and apply metadata schemas. In addition, the successful candidate will troubleshoot pipeline issues, monitor data quality, and contribute to the improvement of a publicly exposed analytics API endpoint. They will also support the team’s projects as they relate to data sourcing, cleaning and ensuring data use is auditable.

The Junior Data Engineer will also be expected to help with the data analysis and research being conducted on an ongoing basis by the economics team. This includes cleaning and organizing a variety of data from different sources for one-off use and helping to extract salient insights and patterns in the data.

Work requirements
The successful candidate will be able to:

· Support the management of end-to-end data pipelines that gather, clean, sort, label and ingest data into the data repository, using a combination of off-the-shelf tools and pipeline-specific custom scripts.

· Manage the components and technologies used to support the data pipeline infrastructure.

· Understand the relative value of various datasets pertaining to labour markets and how various components can help fulfill end-user needs.

· Apply problem-solving, critical thinking, creativity, organizational, design and interpersonal skills in the context of a multifaceted and fast-moving project.

· Create scalable metadata schemas to be applied to a wide variety of data.

· Work independently and establish priorities that meet organizational deadlines.

· Effectively collaborate with other economists to ensure alignment of deliverables, including reports, data visualizations and presentations.

· Act and react quickly to the changing organizational needs.

· Provide recommendations for improving research methods, research tools and information products to ensure the alignment of high-quality approaches.

Qualifications and knowledge domains
· A master’s degree in computer science, economics or other data-driven fields. Other combinations of education and work experience will be considered.

· Experience working with cloud computing systems (preferably GCP).

· Ability to drive transformation through the automation of existing processes, and testing and optimizing data quality.

· Strong programming skills, knowledge of algorithms and data structures.

· Knowledge of programming languages to analyze and transform data, such as Python and SQL.

· Good understanding of developer tools and techniques such as Git, GitHub/GitLab, CI, testing and Docker.

Assets
· Bilingualism in both official languages (French and English).

· Superior written and verbal communication skills.

· Experience developing cloud-based data repositories.

· Knowledge of dbt and Jinja templating.

· Experience with REST or GraphQL APIs.

Location
LMIC's head office is in an accessible building in downtown Ottawa, and LMIC currently operates in a flexible hybrid work environment. As a pan-Canadian organization, we welcome applications from remote and home-based candidates anywhere in Canada.

Inclusion
At LMIC we are committed to workplace inclusion. Candidates of all backgrounds including but not limited to individuals with international experience, newcomers to Canada, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and persons of various gender identities and sexual orientations are encouraged to apply. We welcome the opportunity to discuss accommodations at any point of the application process.

Compensation and benefits
The position provides a competitive package that aligns with the skills and competencies of the individual, and includes extended health coverage, flexible work/life policies, vacation, sick and personal leave, and RRSP benefits. The position entails a full-time employment opportunity under an 18-month contract with the possibility of renewal.

The starting salary range for this position is $68,000 – $78,000, commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications.

How to apply
Apply through Indeed no later than May 11, 2022.

Contact Information
If you require accommodations, alternative job posting formats, alternative application methods, or any other support with your application please contact us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Titre du poste : Ingénieur/ingénieure de données subalterne

Supérieur hiérarchique : Responsable des données

Organisme : Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail

Lieu : N’importe où au Canada (télétravail)

À propos du Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail

Le Conseil de l’information sur le marché du travail (CIMT) est un organisme indépendant sans but lucratif qui a été créé pour permettre aux Canadiens et aux Canadiennes de prendre des décisions éclairées en leur donnant accès à des données et à des renseignements de qualité, pertinents et complets dans l’ensemble de l’écosystème pancanadien de l’IMT.

Nos efforts sont motivés par de solides collaborations avec nos partenaires au sein des gouvernements fédéral, provinciaux et territoriaux, des organisations intermédiaires (par exemple, les fournisseurs de services de carrière) et des chercheurs universitaires.

En tant qu’organisme dynamique et public, le CIMT offre la possibilité de travailler sur des données de pointe et des analyses conceptuelles au cœur des défis et des politiques du marché du travail d’aujourd’hui. Nous offrons un environnement de travail flexible et motivant qui soutient l’excellence et récompense l’innovation et le travail créatif qui nous pousse à aller plus loin.

Le poste

Le CIMT est à la recherche d’une personne qui occupera le poste d’ingénieur/ingénieure de données subalterne pour soutenir le développement et la maintenance du début à la fin d’un entrepôt de données infonuagique construit dans une infrastructure de pointe.

L’ingénieur/ingénieure de données subalterne aidera également à créer et à appliquer des schémas de métadonnées. De plus, la personne retenue devra résoudre les problèmes liés au pipeline, surveiller la qualité des données et contribuer à l’amélioration d’un point terminal public d’interface de protocole d’application analytique. Elle soutiendra également les projets de l’équipe en ce qui a trait à l’approvisionnement en données, au nettoyage et à la vérification de l’utilisation des données.

L’ingénieur/ingénieure de données subalterne devra également contribuer à l’analyse des données et aux recherches menées de façon continue par l’équipe économique. Cela comprend le nettoyage et l’organisation d’une variété de données provenant de différentes sources pour une utilisation ponctuelle et l’aide à l’extraction d’idées et de tendances importantes dans les données.

Exigences professionnelles

La personne retenue sera en mesure :

· De prendre en charge la gestion des pipelines de données de bout en bout qui recueillent, nettoient, trient, étiquettent et intègrent les données dans le référentiel de données, en utilisant une combinaison d’outils prêts à l’emploi et de scripts personnalisés propres aux pipelines.

· De gérer les composants et les technologies utilisés pour soutenir l’infrastructure du pipeline de données.

· De comprendre la valeur relative de divers ensembles de données sur les marchés du travail et la façon dont divers éléments peuvent aider à répondre aux besoins des utilisateurs finaux.

· D’appliquer ses compétences en résolution de problèmes, en pensée critique, en créativité, en organisation, en conception et en relations interpersonnelles dans le contexte d’un projet à multiples facettes qui évolue rapidement.

· De créer des schémas de métadonnées évolutifs à appliquer à une grande variété de données.

· De travailler de façon autonome et d’établir des priorités qui respectent les délais de l’organisme.

· De collaborer efficacement avec d’autres économistes pour assurer l’harmonisation des produits livrables, y compris les rapports, les visualisations de données et les présentations.

· D’agir et de réagir rapidement aux besoins changeants de l’organisme.

· De formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les techniques de recherche, les outils de recherche et les produits d’information afin d’assurer l’harmonisation des approches de haute qualité.

Qualifications et domaines de connaissances

· Une maîtrise en informatique, en économie et dans d’autres domaines axés sur les données. D’autres combinaisons d’études et d’expérience professionnelle seront prises en compte.

· Expérience de travail avec l’utilisation de systèmes infonuagiques (de préférence GCP).

· Capacité à diriger la transformation par l’automatisation des processus existants, ainsi que par la mise à l’essai et l’optimisation de la qualité des données.

· Solides compétences en programmation, connaissance des algorithmes et des structures de données.

· Connaissance des langages de programmation pour analyser et transformer les données, comme Python et SQL.

· Bonne compréhension des outils et techniques de développement tels que Git, GitHub/GitLab, CI, testing et Docker.

Atouts

· Bilinguisme dans les deux langues officielles (français et anglais).

· Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale.

· Expérience de l’élaboration de dépôts de données infonuagiques.

· Connaissance des modèles DBT et Jinja.

· Expérience des API REST ou GraphQL.

Lieu

Le siège social du CIMT est situé dans un immeuble accessible au centre-ville d’Ottawa, et le CIMT fonctionne actuellement dans un environnement de travail hybride souple. En tant qu’organisme pancanadien, nous accueillons les candidatures de personnes travaillant à distance ou à domicile au Canada.

Inclusion

Au CIMT, nous nous engageons à favoriser l’inclusion en milieu de travail. Nous encourageons les candidatures de tous les horizons, y compris, mais sans s’y limiter, les personnes ayant de l’expérience à l’étranger, les nouveaux arrivants au Canada, les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les membres des minorités visibles, et les personnes de diverses identités de genre et orientations sexuelles. Nous serons heureux de discuter des mesures d’adaptation à tout moment du processus de candidature.

Rémunération et avantages sociaux

Le poste offre un ensemble de mesures concurrentielles qui reflète les aptitudes et les compétences de la personne, et comprend une assurance-maladie complémentaire, des politiques souples de travail et de vie privée, des vacances, des congés de maladie et des congés personnels, ainsi que des prestations de REER. Il s’agit d’un emploi à temps plein dans le cadre d’un contrat de 18 mois avec possibilité de renouvellement.

L’échelle salariale de départ pour ce poste est de 68 000 $ à 78 000 $, en fonction de l’expérience et des qualifications de la personne retenue.

Comment poser votre candidature

Poser votre candidature par l’intermédiaire de Indeed au plus tard le 11 mai 2022.

Coordonnées

Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, d’autres formats d’affichage d’emploi, d’autres méthodes de candidature ou de tout autre soutien pour votre candidature, veuillez communiquer avec nous et nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 18 months

Salary: $68,000.00-$78,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-11
